meanings.sent1: She enfaces the importance of kindness in her daily interactions.
meanings.sent2: The teacher enfaces the key points of the lesson for the students to remember.
meanings.sent3: The magician enfaces the rabbit in his hat, making it the star of the show.
meanings.sent4: Her smile enfaces her radiant personality, shining brightly in the room.
meanings.sent5: The spotlight enfaces the lead singer, making her the center of attention.

meanings.definition: To bring into focus or clarity
meanings.sent1: The glasses enfaces the words on the page, making them easier to read.
meanings.sent2: The camera enfaces the beautiful landscape, capturing every detail.
meanings.sent3: The detective enfaces the hidden clue, revealing the solution to the mystery.
meanings.sent4: The sunlight enfaces the intricate details of the flower petals, creating a stunning image.
meanings.sent5: The artist enfaces the subject of the painting, bringing it to life on the canvas.

meanings.definition: To stress or give importance to
meanings.sent1: He enfaces the need for teamwork in order to achieve success.
meanings.sent2: The manager enfaces the deadline for the project, urging everyone to work efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The comedian enfaces the absurdity of everyday situations, making the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The alarm enfaces the urgency of the situation, prompting everyone to evacuate quickly.
meanings.sent5: The coach enfaces the value of perseverance, inspiring the team to never give up.
